alert.note: Alert for Perry; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:22AM CST until February 23 at 7:48PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Cheatham, Dickson, Hickman, Humphreys, Montgomery, Perry and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dickson, Ashland City, Waverly, Centerville, Coopertown, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Pegram, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Hurricane Mills, Fairview, Pleasant View, Charlotte, Lobelville, Vanleer, Pinewood, Bon Aqua and Lyles. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
